summary: T. Jeremy Gunn was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents highlight his involvement in the ARRB's efforts to declassify and release records related to the JFK assassination, ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. He was involved in requesting information and records from various agencies, including the CIA and NSA, and addressing concerns about the pace of declassification. Gunn's work included reviewing foreign government information, particularly liaison relationships between the CIA and foreign intelligence services. He also participated in making formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the assassination.
significance: T. Jeremy Gunn's significance lies in his role as a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB), where he actively participated in the declassification and release of JFK assassination records, ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. His work was crucial in making government information related to the assassination available to the public.
